website_summaries.verdict: This low-cost bike computer offers a wide range of useful information.
pros: The outstanding feature is the solar panel that extends battery life
There’s also auto-sleep for even longer life
You get 22 functions, including calorie counter, displayed on a clear, back-lit LCD
cons: Setting up the functions is frustrating

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: If you can get past the poorly written & translated instructions, this little device is actually pretty easy to set- up and install. The batteries are included which is a nice touch. The unit feels secure on the bike with the supplied zip ties and I like how it also comes with rubber backings for both the sensor and the speedometer itself. The multitude of functions are really nice - including the ambient temperature. I'm really going to enjoy having this accessory on my bike!
customer_reviews.author: juliewoo

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect, there are supplied batteries in the transmitter and the unit itself, so time will tell how long these last with the additional solar energy. Easy to use, price is right!
customer_reviews.author: MidnightGroove

customer_reviews.title: Bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Received the bike computer on time and installed it within 15 minutes. Works great and would recommend it to anyone. Update 8/9/2019. Purchased this bike computer on June 12th and while riding my bike today, the odomoter went bonkers! Cannot tell what speed you are really going. Too late to return it but I know I will take it off my bike and find another one to replace it. I would now rate it one star, simply because it did work for two months.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this. Everyone’s review said I was difficult to setup but it’s not! I’ve put over 100 miles on it so far and does everything I wanted it to do and more. I’m putting one on my wife’s bike next!
customer_reviews.author: D.Carder

customer_reviews.title: This is a Trash Product
customer_reviews.text: I set it up it and it looked like it would work after a short ride to test I then took it on a 20 mile ride and couldn't get it to do anything, I had to use my PHONE FREE APP to keep track of my miles and calories. I should return this junk and get one that works and is easy to setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Odometer/Speedometer For A Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great odometer/speedometer for a bike. It has other functions like temperature, etc which I don't use. The only problem was installing the part that reads the magnet. The instructions said have it be 1.5 - 3 MM from the magnet and that was impossible. After watching the video again, I spaced it about 1" (2.5 CM) from the magnet as indicated in the video, and it works perfectly. I think the instructions got CM and MM mixed up and that caused a lot of confusion. As indicated in other videos, I "walked the tire" to get the exact circumference to enter the correct settings and tested the odometer with my car and they are exact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Wireless, Waterproof, both day and night use, solar energy assist, auto sleep, speedometer and distance measure, nice packaging, everything needed is in the packaging, amazon website video plus other review written helps in assembly, numbers displayed are large enough for comfortable viewing from normal/my biking stance, thickness is actually not bad at all Cons: plastic mount could have been stronger, button could have been easy click
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: After watching a couple of videos on YouTube the computer was very easy to install. There are 2 batteries, one in the speedometer/odometer and the other in the sensor that attaches to the bike frame at the wheel. Open each compartment and remove the small circular paper or there will be no battery connection to either device. Take time, don't tighten the zip ties until you know for sure the bike computer is working. Total time for installation under 5 minutes and I was up and running. Can't beat the price, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REPLACEMENT BIKE COMPUTER WORKING FINE
customer_reviews.text: After waiting about 3 weeks for a replacement of my bike computer that was not functioning properly, I am happy to report that the new transmitter is working properly. All parameters are reported correctly and the battery standby function keeps its setting to 0.00 when not in use or moved from its resting location. I am please with the performance of this bike computer. I suggest that the user instructions be re-written to clarify the resetting and long-term storage data instructions once a ride is completed.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J Schoengold

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer.
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, the directions are terrible. Just persevere and you will have a great computer with more features than you will ever need. Never mentioned is that the installed batteries are separated by a paper to protect it. remove paper and replace batteries carefully. The video for installing is a help but omits this critical step. love how no wires are needed to connect sender with receiver.
customer_reviews.author: icepro

customer_reviews.title: It works for me
customer_reviews.text: I only took 1 star off of the installation due to the fact that the instruction booklet is so darn small that I had to take a photo of the page with my phone so I could blow it up big enough to read them. Another important thing is to keep in mind is that you should check that the magnet on the wheel is tight after your first ride and then every now and then after. I do see a small difference in total mileage between this speedometer and the underarmor fitness app on my phone, But it's small enough that it doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gollner

customer_reviews.title: Would  not recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get it to actually work on my bike. In fact the second time after I thought it worked it did not. This one had more features than others I had seen in the past and I thought I would like it but I’m having a really hard time figuring out what settings do you what. I don’t believe it’s very accurate as far as the calories or mileage because I rode my normal routes and it was very different than what my previous tracker would tell me especially when it comes to calories/ mileage. The only thing that seemed accurate was the time and temperature. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Graytee73

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: You’ll receive this item straight off the boat from China. The directions are translated Into English so poorly that they are impossible to follow. The few diagrams are impossible to decipher. You are left to try and figure out two bags of parts while measuring in metric and making calculations to program it correctly. Surely there is an easier way with today’s modern technology. On top of it all, when I sent it back I got hit with a substantial restocking fee. Avoid this item unless you are a mechanical engineer.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyQC

customer_reviews.title: Works well after you learn its quirks
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are not easy to understand, but you can get the general idea of the settings. Setting the wheel circumference was straightforward after you got to the correct input page. Resetting the timer / distance counter can be done but I'm still working out the secret handshake required to do this before each ride. Mounting and installation was very easy. The system worked well right away. Temp feature is interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gosnell

customer_reviews.title: Decent Unit for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like it, so far. I can understand some of the complaints about instructions, but the seller emails you some clarifications and helpful hints. I gave 3 stars on readability as function labels are quite small and hard to read at a glance. The bar mount is a clever design that allows mounting on either stem or bars. It really should be standard for the others to follow. Not sure what functions the solar battery support, so I"m curious to find out how long a single lith battery will last. All in all, it tells me what I need to know (and then some.) I would by another one, if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: Funbob Kickpants

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to read except with my polarized sunglasses but I have that issue with everything. The install was easy and the mileage is accurate. I cannot figure out how to change from Celsius to Fahrenheit but that's a minor issue. I'd also like a trip counter for miles, average speed, and time. But I don't want to spend the money on those features .The price is great and it does what I need maybe not exactly what I want but I'm pretty picky.
customer_reviews.author: KAB

customer_reviews.title: YOU GOTTA TAKE OUT THE CARDBOARD INSULATORS IN BOTH BATTERY COMPARTMENTS.
customer_reviews.text: Sure, they have the easy-to-install video. EXCEPT they omit the most important step to energize the batteries. Take battery out, there is a dime sized paper insulator, which you must remove. Once you do that, go back to the videos! I like the unit.
customer_reviews.author: RickyH

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, good value, poor user manual
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a low priced cycle computer that would last longer than a few others that I've had. These are bare bones models but do what I want. So far this one works fine. As many others have noted, the instructions are terrible. Good luck figuring out how to set the computer for tires larger than 27". But overall, it does the job and is a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Noclevername

customer_reviews.title: No wires, simple install, good value
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions were poorly translated, so if you haven't installed a bike computer you might need some help. Thermometer has reported over 100 degrees f a few times which is wildly incorrect. I cannot vouch for the calorie counter at all. Speed and distance seem pretty accurate, and clock maintains time. All in all it seems a bargain for the price. They include the batteries, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: PNW_SteveA

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing works great. Once you ignore the Chinglish and figure the menu out it's easy to use. I tested the mileage against Strava and it was within a tenth of a mile over ten miles. Of course the caloric count for reference only. You can't expect better at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Speedometer and ODO Odometer to give it more accuracy you can set the circumference of your tire and there is even a table that uses the tire size and converted it. My only problem is that if you press the right button to change the mode you have to take your finger off or it will go another mode and then you'll have to cycle all the way back through and you have to put the sensor and the magnet at just the right angle or it won't work but otherwise it's great for what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, instructions terrible
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great once you figure it out. The instructions are terrible. The English translation doesn't even make sense in most of the sentences. It's a DIY setup using trial and error as a result.
customer_reviews.author: RBlack7557

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate at low speeds
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of challenging hills on my favorite route. When I hit the steep spots and slow down, as my speed goes below 9mph the indicated speed suddenly jumps 10 mph, and I'm looking at 17 when I'm really doing 7-8. If I come to a complete stop and walk the bike, it reads 3-5 mph OK, seems like the problem is when I slow down from 15+ to <9. The error results in exaggerated mileage and average speed for the route. I confirmed this via gps. The device is pretty cheap and otherwise OK.
customer_reviews.author: glm

customer_reviews.title: ‘Crashed after 2 months’
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this June to replace an odometer I lost and was not available anymore, it looked exactly the same. Set up was horrible, but once set up, it seemed to work fine. However, on 3 seperate bike rides since, it has gone Bonkers! Reverting back to set up in the middle of a ride. I’d gladly return it if it wasn’t past the time window!
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: Cool but had a glitch
customer_reviews.text: This little computer has everything I wanted at a great price. The calorie calculator is a nice plus. Easy to install. However, the trip reset didn't work the other day. After fiddling with it for a while, I took out the battery. That caused it to reset. I hope that doesn't happen often.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Turner

customer_reviews.title: I could NOT get this thing to work
customer_reviews.text: I tried it in every possible position, and on all parts of the spokes. It would not work. And the instructions are terrible. No pictures. And translated probably from Chinese to english, hard to understand,, at least for me. I did look at the video and that did not help either because I did everything like in the video.
customer_reviews.author: hugstrees

customer_reviews.title: Could not get to work, even after a replacement was sent.  Appears to be poor Quality Control.
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these on my road bike and it works great. I bought another for my other bike, could not get it to work. I returned it for a replacement. I spent hours trying to get it to function. It does not work either and the return window closed. My recommendation is to steer clear of this product as Quality control makes your purchase a hit or miss proposition. Wasted my money!
customer_reviews.author: Ukuleleblues

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday basic info
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a simple everyday (and night with light) computer. This is all you need outside of ~200$ gps and power output etc etc comps.
customer_reviews.author: TCON

customer_reviews.title: Great computer
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle monitor is perfect for me, as it reads out your speed, distance, time, temperature, etc. The directions are terrible however, and you pretty much have to figure it out on your own with the little they give you. I actually had to ask a bike mechanic, just didn't know how to set the spoke sensor distance. But after the initial set-up, it's been great and I've had no problems with the unit, except for replacing the batteries. I've had it for two years.
customer_reviews.author: David Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Simple item made difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Right out the pack I knew I would be in for some challenges. I installed on my bike and this item just doesn't work. The screen comes on however it doesn't track anything. I have moved the bike sensor around on the bike tire but still nothing. The directions weren't as detailed as I thought they would have been. I wouldn't recommend this item, definitely need a backup option (phone app).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great...one minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I didn't like..the magnetic spoke adapter for the sensor did not fit tight on the spoke..I had to super glue it into place...works great after I did it... other than that it's great!
customer_reviews.author: gerard p. renderman

customer_reviews.title: Bracket breaks too easily.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few of these, once to replace a bracket that was broken (computer was working). Now, I've broken another bracket so the computer is worthless to me. I can't find a replacement for just the bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough range between sensor and main unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have a recumbent bike and unless I have the handlebars at just the right spot, the receiver won't pick up the signal. My old unit didn't have any problems with this, but it decided to stop working on me... Setup was easy enough, but the mounting bracket for the receiver is so thin that it already cracked because I bumped it. If it wasn't so cheap, I would have given it two stars...
customer_reviews.author: G. M.

customer_reviews.title: good, occasional glitches
customer_reviews.text: Works really well most of the time. been having some glitches recently, stops reading. need to investigate the reason. good product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Klybor

customer_reviews.title: the seller was great
customer_reviews.text: This product functions as expected. Very easy set up and operations. The seller made it a lot easier by sending detailed instructions prior to receiving this item on how to set it up. This made it very easy as the instructions that come with it are not as clear. I want to say thanks for that!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great little tool
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying and using any type of device for my bike. I am very pleased with the unit. It was simple and easy to install and once I had played with it a bit it was easy to manage. It is a great idea to always check and make sure your adjustments ok before you ride.
customer_reviews.author: Tod R McVey

customer_reviews.title: It worked for 5 minutes, then never again
customer_reviews.text: I carefully installed the unit. It worked for the first 5 minutes of my first ride with it. Then it stopped working: it only showed "0" miles per hour no matter how I adjusted the magnet and sensor. Instructions not clear. I took it off my bike and replaced with a cheap wired unit. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Erich V. Vieth

customer_reviews.title: Everything works
customer_reviews.text: To date, all features are working as advertised. I like having a temperature gauge that tells me the conditions I'm riding in. The gauge picks up ambient temperature combined with the temperature coming off the road for a good reading of the temperature I'm riding in.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and was easy to install because of the wireless communication between the sensor and display. Also, the setup was very intuitive. Also, the installation instructions were very good.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin C. Justen

customer_reviews.title: Sweet bike computer !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the one to get for sure works awesome. I really like that you can set the backlight to stay on if you're riding at night most of them won't do that. Five stars you bet.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gadget! Video on sale page provides easy to understand installation. Paper instructions included are a head scratcher, tho seller provided better instructions for computer setup via email and continued supoort if needed. Not sure what Im happier with, The device or the dedicated seller! Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Juliette

customer_reviews.title: Rarely worked
customer_reviews.text: The speedometer only worked 10% of the time. I set the magnet within 3mm of the pickup and as close to the display as possible. The display wouldn't communicate with the sending unit unless it was within 6 inches of each other. It never displayed speed in dark conditions and it worked 10% of the time when in sunlight. Batteries tested good. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Tate

customer_reviews.title: wery  good
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this wired bicycle computer, is very convenient to use,small size with extension mount accessories becomes portable when installing such bike gadget on your handle,Handlebar Mount is the ideal companion bike computer,very stable,It's big and easy To read, The touch screen buttons are very responsive, It's accurate, If you are looking for an easy to read Wired Computer Speedometer and Odometer, then this computer is great.
customer_reviews.author: william poe

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate. Recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this bike computer didnt last. I tried it and after 2 rides it snapped off the bracket. The build quality is poor and the overall info provided lags and it's not accurate. I was not satisfied. Contacted seller customer service with no response. Returned back.
customer_reviews.author: nmateo

customer_reviews.title: Speed is good but mileage not so much
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can see the speed while I ride. It was easy to set up. The only thing I do not like is I cannot reset the mileage for every ride, it just keeps calculating all mileage together from all my rides. I have even tried to reset it but when you do that you have to go through all the settings and it still doesn’t rest the mileage. Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Bad Sensor Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Non-functioning sensor right out of the box. I've installed probably a couple dozen bike computers on various bikes over the years so I do know what I'm doing. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I like the large size and light up display. The directions were a little crude, saying to do things that didn't make sense. Over all it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Don Niosi

customer_reviews.title: Good for one summer
customer_reviews.text: The first summer it worked well. The second summer, with new batteries installed, it no longer would read any wheel movement. Likely the blue tooth connection no longer works. I would recommend shopping for a different manufacturer if you want it to last.
customer_reviews.author: WTF

customer_reviews.title: missing batteries... nice!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product. On the description it said batteries included. It did NOT come with any. I was somewhat disappointed since I was looking forward to using it right away and I couldn't. For this I give 3 stars overall.
customer_reviews.author: victoria paredes

customer_reviews.title: Unable to use. Poor Instructions
customer_reviews.text: To begin with the instructions are so inefficient that I had to take my bike to a bike store to have it installed. Once it's installed it doesn't even go on. I have no idea what I'm supposed to do with it the directions are so poor I've gone on line to try and find something on YouTube unable to do so. I have been able to use it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are written is Chinglish - Chinese/English that is difficult to decode.
customer_reviews.text: The computer has many functions - most probably unnecessary. Too much button pushing is a distraction from riding safely. Could not get the speedometer to register mph. It seemed to be defaulted to kmh. Sorry I waited so long to install it - missed the return deadline.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Casterline

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little confusing. but after reading them carefully installation was a breeze. I like the price and the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Vendor
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend based on multiple customer satisfaction. It’s a good product that functioned great for me. Until the plastic mounting tab broke. Why I still give them 5 is because with zero hesitation and immediate action, the vendor replaced the unit. Communication was fast and accurate. It’s good to see a company have such high standards for customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: When calibrated seems to work good
customer_reviews.text: Getting those magnets to line up just right is the trick and if they start to move a bit, it'll lose accuracy. Putting it on a MTB that deals with bumps and small jumps, it needs to be adjusted from time to time which I didn't really want to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: m7

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to read. I have a mountain bike, so I tried to buy this bike computer and received it soon. I usually ride my bike at night and in the dark. The backlight is useful for me. The data can be seen clearly from any angle. After several weeks of work, it is still very good and the data is very accurate. I think it is very useful, helpful and strong for cyclists Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kreher

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Directions with English words but almost impossible to understand. Virtually impossible to reset without removing the battery and reentering all of the setup info again. It wouldn't be worth it even if it was free given the difficulty in setting up and the hopelessness of trying to get it to work consistently.
customer_reviews.author: H in Miami

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy but setting functions- near impossible
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy but setting functions- near impossible. Having 22 functions is easy but being able to use 22 functions is impossible with the instructions they give you
customer_reviews.author: chetly

customer_reviews.title: You need to look up the circumference of you bike tire and wheel to set it and I did it online
customer_reviews.text: Instructions aren’t too good but I got an email where they explain a bit better but so far when I put it next to my gps it’s pretty close and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: mauricio alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Remove battery terminal block (small piece of cardboard) before installing.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were limited, but being of the "when all else fails, read the instructions" philosophy, there was no problem with the installation. With the proper calibration in accordance with the tire circumference, it keeps nearly perfect distance synchronization with GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paper with Instructions needed
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product one year ago but I lost the instruction paper can someone take a copy and scan to me? I need to reset it again. Thanks, Luiz
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: set up is a challenge!
customer_reviews.text: directions are skimpy and figuring out the set up for the parameters (far more than i'll ever need) was very difficult for me. also, default value for wheel circumference is about double that of common 26" wheel. not sure of the basis for that!
customer_reviews.author: RPB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: When I finally got around to installing the bike computer it didn't work. Also it won't allow a bike tire size that is mine. 28x 40c isn't that uncommon of a size but only works for smaller tires. So I give it a 0/10. Find another
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stalker

customer_reviews.title: no wires
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have a speedometer without running all the wires. works great so far are really easy to reset to zero after each ride.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: High quality and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: Installation is simple and the product works well. I like to track my mileage when I ride my bike. I've been out twice since I installed it on my bike, and I haven't had any problems. High quality and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Staci Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for one of my friends. He loves it. He keeps sending me pictures of how many miles he rode lol.
customer_reviews.author: Onur

customer_reviews.title: Every Cyclist Can Use This!
customer_reviews.text: Easily programmed, set up for time & speed on any bike. Great for road & trail bike use.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, everything I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this bike computer. Would buy again, in fact I ordered 2 more. Can’t beat it for price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: Solar powered.
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. I never had any problems yet since I installed it. I ride 50 miles a day and have exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffbrothers

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It was a bit difficult for me to set it up but once I figured it out it's easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: everything is as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It's good enough for my medium trips and at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple & excellent
customer_reviews.text: This little inexpensive gadget is as good as it gets. My 30 000$ Subaru has air temp. only in Fahrenheit . This thing will give it to you in Fahrenheit or Celsius. Also it has 24 H clock, not just AM, PM. Works amazingly well. I have three bikes & three of thees speedos.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Goldin

customer_reviews.title: A must to have
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this long enough to see true durability, but at the price a very nice product. Very easy to install. I watch their video and expected difficulty. Not so, very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Quinlan.

customer_reviews.title: What a pain to install
customer_reviews.text: My unit came in metric units. Can I say, what a pain to convert. The directions are very poor. The installation is a pain also. There are better products out there. I wouldn’t bother with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Large, easy to read numbers. Lots of functions. The scan feature is vey nice, I use it all the time. Liked the one I bought last year so much, I bought this one for my other bike. Fork mounted sensor and spoke mounted magnet aren't as slick as the Cateye this replaced, but they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bourque

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money, does all I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Pianoman

customer_reviews.title: Instructions suck
customer_reviews.text: In the process of setting up and I find it a pain in the ass. The instructions with the package are useless,so the seller sent instructions and I'm just pushing buttons just to convert to miles from KM etc. Might send it back,not worth the bother..
customer_reviews.author: P. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: The installation is very simple!
customer_reviews.text: The installation is very simple. It's also very conspicuous. It's also small!! It doesn't hinder anything. It can tell you how fast you are. I have been driving to it at different speeds. This small speedometer is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Gillenwater

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible. Everything was installed properly. No many how many time I adjusted it it would not display any data. I even removed the paper insulating the batteries during shipment. The batteries were properly installed. I set the device for the correct tire circumference. And I made sure the computer and magnet were set at the proper distance. It would not record even one tenth of a mile or any mph. Product was made in China and the directions were horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate Device & Decent Value
customer_reviews.text: It is an adequate device and a decent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in Akron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an adult trike and it was a breeze to install and setup.
customer_reviews.author: W3BY

customer_reviews.title: Good work!
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says! Super easy to install. I think it’s a great value for someone looking for a speedometer or odometer like I was! Seems like it works with just about any bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install; great display
customer_reviews.text: The computer was easy to mount and the transmitter worked first time. After determining the setting for 29" wheel, it is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Benson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I like it easy to read, easy to install and the price was right,This is the one to get for sure works awesome. I really like that you can set the backlight to stay on if you're riding at night,Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty picky
customer_reviews.text: It's sometimes doesn't read. The sensor really needs to be close to the other piece. When you hit a bump that makes it move, all of a sudden it's not reading anymore
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Great if it works
customer_reviews.text: First one of these worked great, and is still working great I might add. However, I ordered another one and it doesn't work, seems it doesn't pick up the signal
customer_reviews.author: Bubb

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the odometer I was sent does not work. I suspected that it didn’t work and tried everything to troubleshoot it but nothing helped. I compared it with an app and smart watch. It was off on time and distance by a considerable amount each time. I am now outside the return window and stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: MC 1023

customer_reviews.title: The computer came on time as noted and everything was intact.
customer_reviews.text: The computer works great and is very reasonably priced. So far, I couldn't be happier. It was easy to install however the directions were poorly written and need to be edited and rewritten. That's the only reason for the 4 Stars on installation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lang

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up works very well,This product is easy to install. I use it on the gym bike and it's very accurate. I really like it! It's also very simple to use and very suitable for outdoor travel! Absolutely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Temperamental -I wish I spent more $ for something user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I still have not successfully set this up. It comes with instructions but you're supposed to adjust a lot of settings and I can't seem to do that despite making several concentrated efforts.
customer_reviews.author: ruggersmith

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: This item is not easy to install the light is not bright as it suppose to be I don’t recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Good convenient product
customer_reviews.text: Good product very informative... installation went well.. I would say it’s pretty accurate
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Sun power
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, instructions not very good but if you are at least a shade tree mechanic you can figure it out
customer_reviews.author: PAUL D WHAREN

customer_reviews.title: Read between the lines.
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions not real clear. No instructions which rubber pad goes wit which item. No pictures or instructions on where three buttons were located. Learned button location and operating systems by trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Law

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable product! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great performance, good set up instructions. Easy to install...only problem I had was that the included zip ties would break when cinched down.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, been a few months, had a few rain drops on it. The display wasn't hard to configure with a little trial and error, no worse than programming a digital watch
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Can't even review
customer_reviews.text: I cannot review this item because I have never been able to get it to work so was never able to use it. Waste of money. Don't bother purchasing. We have been trying for months to get this to connect with no luck. We just gave up. We will have to buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: This product  is absolutely inferior.  Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for installation are poorly written and make no sense. The readings are in kilometers. I strongly recommend that anyone interested in buying a odometer, stay away from this product, spend a little more and get a product that has some quality. I have returned this product to Amazon for credit.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley J Kleban

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: I was just looking for an odometer and this came with a lot of extras but it was hard to program for the odometer readout and it quit working after the first two times I used it. Tried replacing the battery and still nothing. Not worth the money and since I don't ride that often, it's too late to get a refund. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work at all, and the magnet fell off the bike because it was made cheaply. Don't buy garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Furr

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install and does what it says it will. My issue is it stopped working after 6 months. Doesn’t seem to be getting power and I’ve tried everything to fix it but it’s junk now. We will see if they stand by their product. If they do I will write a follow-up, otherwise but it knowing it has a short-term lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ICOCOPRO Bike Computer with Solar Energy Bicycle Speedometer and Odometer Wireless Waterproof Cycling Computer LCD Backlight Automatic Wake-up & Multi-Functions
feature_bullets: 【2019 NEW DESIGN - SOLAR ENERGY】:With solar panel ,It can automatically charge in the sunshine or light,provide extra power to the computer while built-in 2 batteries to keep your ordinary electricity need.Environmental protection, Extend battery service life and Save your money. When mounting with the battery of the sensor, please pay attention to points of the power connection.( press the iron piece to make the battery and equipment fully contact)

【MULTI FUCTIONS AND WIDE APPLICABLE】:Built-in 22 functions,works well to measure speed,distance,riding time calorie counter and etc which what any serious bicyclist or fitness fanatic needs.Small size ,lightweight and wireless design make it suitable for most types of bicycles(may not suit for some type with large spokes)

【AUTO SLEEP FUNCTION】：After no signal inputs of 300 seconds, the screen will go into a standby sleep mode with LCD displays. When you shake it or any signal is inputted or any button is pressed,this cycle computer will automatically wake up

【WIRELESS & WATERPROOF DESIGN】:Wireless and Waterproof Design makes it more convenient and durable.Never worried about the complex in install the wires on your handlebars,No need to worry about rain.Simple installation that only takes a few minutes. Easy to navigate interface with only two buttons to access all measurements.JUST ENJOYING YOUR RIDING

【DAY & NIGHT BACKLIGHT】:Provides backlight and large LCD display for easy viewing during dark hours.The backlight will automatically turn on for 4 seconds per time between 17:00 and 07:00,press both button to keep the light on

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
